name: market for electricity, medium voltage, aluminium industry | electricity, medium voltage, aluminium industry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11670/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset describes the electricity available on the medium voltage level for the Asian (without China) primary aluminium-industry, i.e. used for primary aluminium production only. Aluminium industry specific markets are needed in an LCI database because primary aluminium production is very energy intensive, and hence the location of production plants is often determined by access to large amounts of cheap electricity, which often results in an electricity mix that is different from the general grid mix of the countries where the production plants are located.

This activity physically starts from 1kWh of electricity fed into the medium voltage transmission network. However, it only pertains to electricity that will be used by the primary aluminium industry.

This activity ends with the transport of 1 kWh of medium voltage electricity in the transmission network over aerial lines and cables.
This dataset includes: 
 - electricity inputs produced in primary aluminium producing countries of this region and transformed to medium voltage that will be consumed by the primary aluminium industry  
 - the transmission network
 - direct emissions to air (SF6 from the insulation gas in the high voltage level switchgear are allocated to the electricity demand on medium voltage). 
 - electricity losses during transmission 
This dataset doesn't include
 - electricity losses during transformation from high to medium voltage or medium to low, as these are included in the dataset for transformation
  - leakage of insulation oil from cables and electro technical equipment (transformers, switchgear, circuit breakers) because this only happens in case of accidental release
 - SF6 emissions during production and deconstruction of the switchgear, as these are accounted for in the transmission network dataset.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

location.name: IAI Area, Asia, without China and GCC

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Aluminium producing Asian countries (without China) (AZ, IN, ID, IR, JP, KZ, MY, TJ, TR)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average technology used to transmit and distribute electricity. Includes underground and overhead lines, as well as air-, vacuum- and SF6-insulated high-to-medium voltage switching stations.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Assumptions for the amount of transmission network per kWh transported and emissions per kWh are based on Swiss data. Only losses are specific to the aluminium industry in that they are calculated as the aluminium industry electricity consumption weighted average of losses, using country level loss factors when available (IN, ID, JP, MY, TR) . For AZ, IR, KZ and TJ, country-specific loss data are not available (i.e. the electricity production of the countries is not modelled in ecoinvent), and 'Rest of World' losses are used as an approximation.

exchanges.description:
Literature value/estimation. 
Electricity production weighted average of the SF6 emissions in all 50 countries in ecoinvent v3.

SF6 (sulphur hexafluoride) is used as quenching and insulation gas in gas-insulated switchgear. SF6 has physically ideal properties for the use in high and medium voltage switchgear.

Most of SF6-emissions (ca. 95%) are caused by the high voltage level switchgear, which are allocated to the electricity demand on medium voltage.

The emission rate of 1.0% has been taken from UBA (1999) Schwefelhexafluorid. Retrieved 14.8.2002 from: http://www.ubavie.gv.at/publikationen/uba-aktuell/archiv/1999/08/SF6.html.

location.name: IAI Area, Asia, without China and GCC

exchanges.description:
Estimation. Data overtaken from Switzerland. 

Swiss data are calculated values based on the electricity transported in this voltage level (57268 GWh) and the total medium voltage power line length in Switzerland (cables and aerial lines - 42671 km). Lifetime is assumed to be 40 years. 

See Itten&Frischknecht 2012, Tab. 4.1 and Tab. 4.3.
